content.question: Let f be the function given by f(x) = x3−7x + 6. (a) Find the zeros of f.

frqParts.text: Let f be the function given by f(x) = x3−7x + 6. (a) Find the zeros of f.
(b) Write an equation of the line tangent to the graph of f at x = −1.

(c) Find the number c that satisfies the conclusion of the Mean Value Theorem for f on the closed interval <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> [ </mo> <mrow> <mn> 1 </mn> <mo> ,  </mo> <mn> 3 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ] </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> .

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
